thread.title: A member of Liverpool’s Istanbul team retires to become a DJ
thread.title_full: A member of Liverpool’s Istanbul team retires to become a DJ

author: James
title: A member of Liverpool’s Istanbul team retires to become a DJ
text:
A member of Liverpool’s Istanbul team retires to become a DJ   Cisse at Liverpool 
One of the key members of Liverpool’s 2005 Champions League final win has retired – and started a second career as a DJ. Djibril Cisse scored a crucial penalty in their shoot-out victory against Milan. 
The game famously ended 3-3 after Liverpool managed to come from three goals down to take the game to extra-time. He scored their first goal of the campaign in a win over AS Monaco. 
A broken leg marred Cisse’s first season at Anfield but he still managed to five goals in all competitions. He followed that up with 19 the following season, including one in their FA Cup final win over West Ham. J ai l honneur et la joie d annoncer que fais la premiere partie de la grande mariah carey demain soir a bercy pic.twitter.com/zT1Yicabj6 
— Djibril Cisse (@DjibrilCisse) April 20, 2016 After Anfield 
After leaving Liverpool in 2006, Cisse went on to play for nine more clubs, including Sunderland and QPR. 
He most recently appeared for lower-league French side JS Saint-Pierroise. Speaking about the end of his football career and the beginning of a new full-time venture, Cisse said: “I loved being a footballer, and so far the ball has been my life. I would have liked to continue playing but I must admit today that football is over. 
“With the same passion, I will devote myself wholeheartedly to my career as DJ, producer and consultant, as well as developing my clothes brand. Thanks to all of you for your support. 
“The adventure continues, another life begins. A lion never dies.” Loading tags...
